properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Okeechobee; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 6:23AM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
At 6 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic
cameras indicated that patchy dense fog had formed in Brevard,
Indian River, Saint Lucie and Okeechobee counties. The fog was
reducing visibilities below one mile across many areas, and below
one half mile in some locations. The fog had not yet reached
Martin County but could develop there in the next hour or so. The
fog will lift by 9 am.

If you will be out driving early this morning, you should plan on
leaving early, to allow yourself extra time to safely reach your
destination. When driving in dense fog, reduce your speed, use your
low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle
and the one in front of you.

NWSheadline: Patchy Dense Fog Has Formed This Morning
